bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, February 3, 1901

div1.p: Reed teases Emilie Lawrence Reed. He will be leaving for Cuba in a week. Lawrence Reed's battalion has been ordered to move, either to the United States or to the Philippines, and he mentions that Lawrence has a Cuban girlfriend.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, February 3, 1901
div1.opener:
The Congress
opens tomorrow-
Don't expect too
many letters
this week- I'll
be home, next
week, do you
understand?
Boo!!!!!
Columbia Barracks,
Quemados, “Cuby”,
Feb. 3rd 1901-
My dear Miss Fatty Oomsey:
div1.p:
Well, if
you are not the sweetest Miss
Fatty that ever lived, I don't
know! call me “Mr Smarty”, did
you? Well, I like that! And
you are “getting old”!! Just wait
till I get there, and I'll see if I
can't take some of that stiffness
and “old age” out of your bones!
I'll propose to give you the
greatest shaking up that you
have ever had! Just put that
in your pipe and smoke it; do
you hear? Bless your darling
heart, the reason I didn't
write a postscript on the
the morning on which the mail
leaves, was because I was
trying to get a little sleep in
the morning! and for that, my
precious oomsey jumps on me
with both feet! But I know
that you don't mean one
word you say- When I get
back, I know that you will
be so glad to set eyes
on you good-looking, Mr
Mantee, that you will re-
ceive him with both arms
open! Yess you will, Miss
Fatty! Darboy wrote me the
other day that he had failed
to write to you for the first
time that since he had been
in Cuba- And I straightway
said to myself, “Lordy! but
won't his Mama dress that
young man down”! He! He!!
Well, Sweet Lady of 19th St., I
went down, yesterday, to Havana,
andgo got permission to go on
the Ward Line Steamer, Havana,
which leaves at 1 P.M. Saturday
Next, Feb. 9th- So don't worry
anymore, Miss Sweetness and
Prettyness, but just think of me
as sailing on the “briny deep”
from that time till Tuesday noon,
12th, when we should about make
New York Harbor- By the way,
did you know that Darboy's
regiment has been relieved
from duty in Cuba and ordered
to the U.S. via New Orleans-
Two battalions will start
pretty soon for the Phillip-
pines I guess- Whether his
battallion will stay in the
U.S. as the home battalion
I don't know, but hope so-
I heard that he was in love
with a red-headed Cuban girl-
Wouldn't that be jolly? Well,
I should say so! How would you
like a red-headed daughter-
in-law? This evening, I again
went to Tea at Major Dunn's and
had something real good to eat-
I don't know why, but they
seem to have taken a fancy
to me and are awfully nice about
having me at their house- She
is the daughter of same Congressman
from Pa, & just as pleasant as
she can be- Now, dearest heart,
you must excuse this pen, for
its the worst, I ever did try-
Excuse this short letter, which
I think is much better than no
letter, don't you? Be a good little
oomsey till I get there and take
good care of precious little lamb-
Kiss her & “Dooggy” for their grandpa.
Love & kisses for my sweet, sweet
girls- Boo! Boo!
